passwordInfo: Info: Password functionality is unable due to missing password field in JSON Placeholder API. Just enter existing username to log in.
notLoggedInMessage1: It looks like you're trying to access a page you can't access.
welcomePageMessage2: Buid your own account, write posts & publish photos
welcomePageMessage3: Let other people see and comment your work
aboutPageParagraphOne1: This is a pure React framework project, without a written backend. The data is pulled from the
aboutPageParagraphOne2: page and is treated as a REST API. This is a site that provides a fake API (tables of users, their photos, posts, comments, etc.)
aboutPageParagraphOne3: The intent of the application is social media, where the user can log in, insert photos/posts and comment on the work of others. A non-logged-in user does not have access to most of the site's content. Since the Placeholder API does not offer real data management, when a particular event is executed (for example, inserting a photo), the photo in question will not appear on the refreshed page, but the data exchange handling on the React side works fine.
aboutPageParagraphOne4: What is worth mentioning, the appearance of the site was 100% designed by us in pure scss and bootstrap was not used to create the application.
aboutPageParagraphTwo1: The application uses most of the tables provided by the Placeholder API and most of the capabilities for managing this data (CRUD operations). Therefore, in the application, a user can log in, but without providing a password (since the Placeholder API only has a username field), view photos available in the database, browse user albums, view posts and insert/view comments, add new photos and posts and delete their own, search for photos in the browser, and search for users with a given username in the browser and edit their profile data.
aboutPageParagraphThree1: The application has several upgrades that make the user's time while using the app more pleasant. These include:
